item.title: By: Casey Hough
item.dc:creator: Casey Hough
item.description:
To clarify, most commentators would disagree that Hebrews 4 teaches the perpetual existence of a "sabbath day" the way that sabbatarians do. As for Colossians 2, it appears as though Paul would probably have to disagree as well since he calls the Sabbath a "shadow" of which He identifies "Christ" as the substance. So if Christ has come and inaugurated the "already" of the "not yet" rest, then I find it hard to imagine that the shadow maintains the same significance once the substance is revealed. Doubtless you will disagree, but the brevity of my comment indicates that I am not interested in persuasion, but rather, mere statement.
On another front though, I am thankful for many of the resources that are available here. May the Lord continue to bless your ministry.
